page.title: 19The Farm at Trigon
page.content: There are 550 acres of farmland at Trigon.The farm has 115 dairy cows and approximately 180 beef animals.Every cow has one calf a year in the autumn and these are reared for beef. The farm land is mainly grass with some corn and fodderbeet which is grown to feed the cattle. A Day At Trigon by J.Bryant Every morning Di's cockeral wakes me up.Dad has gone to work already.Some mornings Dad has to begin milking at five-o-clock.In June and July they make silage,Les cuts the grass and Dad picks it up and puts it into a trailer with a forage harvester.Alice and Giles then take it to a silage clamp.When we are making silage the cows are not milked until the evening.Ken does all the milking. When the cows have been mlked and are let out I always hear the calves call.
